intro: Badula barthesia, commonly known as the Barthes' badula, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, violet-blue petals and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Its flowers bloom during the late spring and early summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Badula barthesia is considered a vulnerable species.
